Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives
Ernest Amatniek Papers
Amatniek, Ernest
Amatniek, Kathie
Amatniek, Joan Cindy
ALBA.309
2.5 Linear Feet in 1 record carton, 1 manuscript box, 1 flat box, and 1 oversize folder.
1929-2005 Ernest Amatniek (1915-2005) was born in 1915 in Estonia and in 1929 emigrated to the United States. In February 1937, Amatniek joined and served with the XV International Brigade, Transmissiones squad that fought for the Spanish Republic in the Spanish Civil War. The Ernest Amatniek Papers are comprised of materials related to his service with the International Brigades, and includes pamphlets, flyers, postcards and publications collected while he was in Spain in the 1930s. Also included are his photographs, correspondence, and a Veterans of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade membership card. The collection also includes commemorative materials from the 50th and 60th anniversaries of the International Brigades, as well as ephemera from the 1997 commemoration of the support for defense of the Spanish Republic within communities of Spanish heritage in Tampa, Florida in the 1930s. This collection also includes honors and other materials from Amatniek's memorial service in 2005. Materials are in English, Spanish, Albanian, and Estonian.
Scope and Contents
The Ernest Amatniek Papers are comprised of materials created and collected by Ernest Amatniek documenting his experiences with the International Brigades during the Spanish Civil War. The collection includes pamphlets, flyers, postcards, and publications collected by Amatniek while he was in Spain in the 1930s. Other material includes photographs, correspondence, and a Veterans of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade membership card. The collection also includes commemorative materials from the 50th and 60th anniversaries of the International Brigades, in addition to ephemera from the 1997 commemoration of the support for defense of the Spanish Republic within communities of Spanish heritage of Tampa, Florida in the 1930s. This collection also includes honors and other materials from Amatniek's memorial service in 2005.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Biographical Note
Ernest Amatniek was born in 1915 in Estonia and in 1929, emigrated to the United States. Amatniek attended James Monroe High School in the Bronx and the City College of New York where he studied electrical engineering. In February 1937, Amatniek joined and served with the XV International Brigade, Transmissiones squad fighting for the Spanish Republic in the Spanish Civil War. Amatniek passed away in April 2005 at the age of 90 in Bucks County, Pennsylvania.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Ernest Amatniek, the creator of this collection, were relinquished and transferred to the public domain in April 2019 by Joan Cindy Amatniek and Kathie Amatniek. These materials are governed by a Creative Commons CC0 license, which permits publication and reproduction of materials accompanied by full attribution. See, https://creativecommons.org/licenses/
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Joan Cindy Amatniek and Kathie Amatniek in April 2019. The accession number associated with this gift is 2019.065.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Ernest Amatniek Papers; ALBA 309; box number; folder number or item identifier; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning, materials were rehoused in archival boxes and folders, with loose materials foldered in the order in which they appeared. Materials were described on the collection-level.
